Job Title: Project Coordinator, Civics and History Content
Job Description:
The Content Project Coordinator will work with the Education Content team and be responsible for the day-to-day management of content projects. This will encompass content development, quality assurance, vendor management, and reporting.
What makes you perfect for this position?
- You obsess over details.
- You consider deadlines to be absolute and not suggestions.
- You understand how to diplomatically hold the team to the project schedule no matter their level at the organization.
- You are a kind and confident person.
- You are comfortable championing your ideas and proud of your team's accomplishments
Responsibilities:

 Coordinate day-to-day curricular production, supporting the development and production of K-12 resources and materials, including:
 Overseeing the development and execution of project timelines.
 Identifying project priorities and supporting team members in meeting project milestones
 Managing all content through vetting and quality processes, ensuring all content is academically sound, accurate, and properly cited.
 Ensuring all appropriate rights and licenses are acquired and documented.
 Maintaining file and naming systems. Writing, and editing as needed.
 Assist Engagement in the coordination of timelines and final publication.

Expectations:

 All projects are accurate, error-free, relevant, and adapted for classroom use.
 All projects are completed on time and on budget.
 All projects receive relevant market feedback from subject matter experts and classroom educators.
 All projects align with BRI style and language guidelines.
 All stakeholders are informed and kept apprised of project status.
 Participate in ongoing, relevant professional development.
